SENT.plain: INTRODUCTION: Retroperitoneal abscesses have been previously reported to cause infectious meningitis
Cerebral infarction is a known complication of basilar meningitis

SUMMARY OF CASE: We present a case where a comatose patient with a known retroperitoneal abscess was diagnosed via Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) with extensive brainstem infarction secondary to basilar meningitis
